javadoc:
A debugging, timing, and diagnostic tool

methods.javadoc:
Create a new debugging timer, wrapping the given output stream
@param out the stream
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Create a new debugging timer, wrapping the given output stream

methods.javadoc: Create a new debugging timer, wrapping standard out
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Create a new debugging timer, wrapping standard out

methods.name: start
methods.comment: Start a new, possibly long-running, task

params.name: message
params.comment: the message to print when the task begins

return.comment:
a context to close when the task ends
 
 This is meant to be used idiomatically, as in a try-with-resources block:
 
 
 
 
 This idiom is preferred because the task will be stopped even if an error occurs, if the
 method returns from within the block, etc.

methods.javadoc:
Stop the current task
 
 This will print done and the elapsed time since the start of the task. The "current task" is
 determined from the stack.
methods.name: stop
methods.comment:
Stop the current task
 
 This will print done and the elapsed time since the start of the task. The "current task" is
 determined from the stack.

methods.name: setOutputStream
methods.comment: Replace the wrapped output stream (usually temporarily)

return.comment: the original stream, wrapped in a tabbing stream

methods.name: resetOutputStream
methods.comment: Put the original tabbing stream back

return.comment: the replacement stream, wrapped in a tabbing stream
